He he. Is that just me who required to write tests when submitting patches? :-)
I thought I could get away with it since it's a one line fix :).

Created an attachment (id=74026)
test case

Test case that verifies that null is a legal value for currentTask. A lot more tests should be written for this class at some point.

Patch also has minor optimizations to PersonProposalProvider (which do not need to be merged).

(In reply to comment #4)
> He he. Is that just me who required to write tests when submitting patches? :-)

This is a good point.  I had the exact same thought just before applying it, then dismissed it for the same reasoning as Steffen did (no change to functionality, but a simple already verified fix).  While we figure out the policy for when tests are required it's definitely good to err on the side of having them.  Even a very simple test helps and ensures that there is a harness in place for future tests.  Leading up to 1.0 we were quite good at sticking to this policy and need to get back to that.
